intro: Gomesa loefgrenii, commonly known as the Loefgren's gomesa, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
